# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    words = split(text)
    result = ""
    for (i, word) in enumerate(words)
        if i > 1 && length(result) + length(word) + 2 > text_width # adjust for spaces
            result *= "\n"
        end
        result *= word * " "
    end
    return result[1:end-1]  # remove the extra space at the end
end

Example usage:
text = "This is a very long sentence with more than 5 words to test our wrapping function."
println(wrap_string(text))
